1.rationale:
Let’s analyze our situation. Our snake’s head is at (0,0), and its body occupies (0,1), (0,2), (0,3), (1,3), (1,2), (1,1), and (1,0). When we move, unless we eat an apple, the very last segment (the tail) will vanish from the board and free up that cell.

Looking at our adjacent squares from (0,0):

• UP: (0,1) is filled with a body segment that isn’t the tail (it will remain occupied).  
• LEFT: (–1,0) is off the board.  
• DOWN: (0,–1) is off the board.  
• RIGHT: (1,0) is currently occupied, but it is our tail, which will be removed if we do not eat an apple.  

Thus, moving RIGHT is safe because the tail will vacate (1,0) as we advance.

For our strategy going forward, by moving RIGHT we free up space and give ourselves potential access to navigate further toward an apple in future turns.

I decide to move: RIGHT.
